org.openhubframework.openhub.api.configuration

Annotation Type ConfigurableValue


  • @Qualifier
 @Documented
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ConfigurableValue
    Marks a configurable parameter as being eligible for system configuration.

    Annotation is used to inject configuration parameter wrapper that encapsulates system property and resource provider.

    Example how to use: 

       @ConfigurableValue ("ohf.asynch.confirmation.intervalSec")
    private ConfigurationItem<Integer> interval;
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Tomas Hanus

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String key
      The key as ID of system parameter to inject.
      boolean required
      Declares whether the annotated system parameter is required.
      String value
      Alias for key().

    • Element Detail

      • value

        @AliasFor(value="key")
public abstract String value
        Alias for key().

        Intended to be used instead of key() when key() is not declared — for example: @ConfigurableValue("key.name") instead of @ConfigurableValue(key = "key.name").

        Returns:
        the key name of system parameter
        See Also:
        key()
        Default:
        ""

      • key

        @AliasFor(value="value")
public abstract String key
        The key as ID of system parameter to inject.
        Returns:
        the key name of system parameter
        See Also:
        value()
        Default:
        ""

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        Declares whether the annotated system parameter is required.

        Defaults is true.

        Returns:
        true if the parameter is required. false otherwise.
        Default:
        true
